最强大脑：一小时串记1000词
时间：3月26日（星期三） 19:00 - 20:00
主讲老师：张介英（点击关注老师的沪江部落>>>）
公开课地点：英语活动室（点击下载CCTalk）

讲师简介：

张介英
台湾地区新闻主播、节目主持人，畅销书作者，专业同声传译。前年代新闻台ERA TV NEWS主播、Much TV主持人、东风卫视《娱乐@亚洲》主播；出版《英文王子张介英》、《TOEIC满分》。
点击关注老师的沪江部落>>

视频回顾：

课堂内容提要：

一、词源（Etymology）
1.Definition: The study of the origin of words and the way in which their meanings have changed throughout history.(Source: Oxford Dictionary)
2.Origin+word composition+word meaning
3.academic(L.F.ME) vs. practical(词根)
4.举例：中文部首（radical）

二、最常见词缀：教你通过词根词缀背单词，一小时单词量暴增
厘清基本定义：
1.前缀（prefix）：是或否/方向/数量
normal abnormal
subway progress
bilateral unify bicycle
2.后缀（suffix）：改变词性，不改变意
consider consideration
compete competition
3.例词拆解 predictable
4.”词根"延伸记忆法：举一反多
predictable, predictably, predictability, predict, predicted, predictive, predictively, prediction, predictor

三、常见词构形态
1.前缀+词根
Include in=in + clud/clus = close
predict pre=before + dict=say
reduce re-back + duc/duct=lead
2.前缀+前缀+词根
coincide co=together + in=in + cid=cut/kill
recollect re=back + col=together + lect=select
3.前缀+词根+后缀
requirement re=back + quir=ask/seek + -ment
diffident di=away + fid=trust + -ent
4.前缀+前缀+词根+后缀
insufficient in=not + suf=wner + fic=make + -ent
irrevocable ir=not + re=back + voc=call + -able
5.前缀+词根+词根+后缀
insignificant in=not + sign=sign + fic=make + -ant
remanufacture re=again + manu=hand + fac=make + -ure
6.前缀+词根+后缀+后缀
differentiate dif=away + fer=carry + -ent + -ate
compassionate com=together + pass=feel + -ion + -ate
7.前缀+前缀+词根+后缀+后缀
Indifferently dif=away + fer=carry + -ent + -ate + -ly
unpredictably un=not +pre=before + dict=say + -able + -ly
8.词根
claim = cry out
pend = hang
9.词根+词根
artifact art=skill + fact=make
facsimile fac=make + simile=like
10.词根+后缀
dictate dict=say + -ate
tractable tract=draw + -able
11.词根+词根+后缀
manufacture manu=hand + fac=make + -ure
magnificence mag=great + fic=make -ence
12.词根+后缀+后缀
dictator dict=say + -ate + -or
clamorous clam= cry out + -or + -ous
13.词根+字根+后缀+后缀
magnificently magn=great + fic=make + -cent + -ly

description:
2014年6月英语四级六级考试马上就要来临了，提到四六级作文，大家是不是已经背了不少模板呢？背会了模板固然很好，但是千万不要忽略了最基本的词汇的积累。如果缺乏相应的词汇积累，有的考生可能连图表（画）作文上的英文注释都看不懂，理解错误可能会导致文章写跑题。更有甚者，写出的只有模板，言之无物，也是写作的大忌！

近两年来，四级作文命题喜欢将时下热点以漫画或图片的形式展现。尤其是互联网，更成为话题的“宠儿”。假如给大家一幅漫画，画中两人正在讨论自己在微博上看过的东西，讨论得特别开心，感觉彼此一见如故，相见恨晚。这样一幅画提炼出来的内容，同样用老生常谈的三段式可以解决，那就是：
1. 如今微博（microblog）越来越普及
2. 微博普及对于社会生活的影响
3. 我的观点

下面就一起来看看，如何围绕这一提纲展开文章，写出内容详实的高分作文！

一、引言段常用词

首段可以先点出微博迅速流行的原因——随着互联网的发展和普及，微博进入了人们的生活。With the development and the popularity of the Internet, many newly-born terms such as microblog have found their ways into our everyday life. 在描述社会现象时，with the development and the popularity of… “随着……的发展和普及”是最常用的表原因的词汇。央视网CCTV.COM对微博现象也有报道，表达也同样使用了with结构。

With the increasing numbers of smartphones and Chinese Internet users, micro blogging, known as Weibo in Chinese, has seen a surge.

See a surge指事物的突然发生和激增，考试时surge这样难度的词语考生可能想不到。这里使用sth. have/has found their way into our everyday life，既生动形象又地道地表达了“某种新兴事物进入人们的生活”的意思。另外，想表达微博迅速流行还可以使用短语become a huge overnight sensation，或see an explosive growth给文章增色加分。

参考引言段：
With the development and the popularity of the Internet, many newly-born terms such as microblog have found their ways into our everyday life. Microblog has become a huge overnight sensation in China.

二、正文段常用词

某种现象的流行或普及必然对社会或人们“产生巨大的影响”，所以在现象解释类写作中，一定要记住这个短语的表达——“产生巨大的影响”：exert a great/negative/huge influence/impact on，其中修饰语部分可以根据具体写作内容灵活替换为表示“巨大的，负面的，意义重大的，积极的”等含义的词语(great/negative/significant/active)。接下来，文章应该从几个方面（firstly, secondly, thirdly, last but not least/moreover）阐述微博对社会产生的影响。

与传统博客不同，微博集合了众多轻量级元素如：至多140个字的文字信息，可附图片、视频或链接。

微博还是人们获取实时消息的重要来源，借助互联网，在微博上发布的任何消息人们都能在第一时间收到。

微博改变了信息传递的方式——普通人也可以成为重大事件的记录者发布者。

人们在微博平台上发表观点，讨论感兴趣的话题。微博在人们沟通交流中起着重要作用。

以上可以看作是正文段中展开阐述的四点具体内容，涉及的一些难点词汇如下：
发布信息：release information
交换信息：exchange information
图片和视频：images and videos
链接：links
实时消息：real-time news
第一时间：immediately/in seconds
亲历的，第一手的：first-hand
网民：netizen
信息传递：spread of information
信息来源：source of news/information
起着重要作用：play an important role in
成为：work as/act as

参考正文段：
The widespread use of microblog exerts a great influence on our daily life. Firstly, microblog allows users to share small elements of contents with friends or strangers, such as short sentences no more than 140 words, individual images, videos or links, which are totally different from those of traditional blog. Secondly, microblog has also emerged as an important source of real-time news, which reaches its audience in seconds. Thirdly, microblogging have revolutionized the way information is spread. By recording and releasing first-hand news, many ordinary netizens can act as sources of information, too. Last but not least, microblog offers a platform for people to discuss hot topics, share opinions and stay in touch, which plays an important role in communication with the public.

三、结尾段常用词

最后一段要求阐明自己的观点，表达观点的常用语有as far as I'm concerned/as to me/to my thought, 表达“我同意，我认为”可以用这些短语in a word/I agree with that…/I am in favor of…。

参考结尾：
As far as I'm concerned, microblog provides a newly-emerged useful and convenient communication tool for people. I'm in complete agreement with the phrase "microblogging, flattering the world."

除了以上提到的各段常用表达外，沪江英语教研再给大家推荐一些现象解释类写作中的常用表达和词汇：
accumulate precious experience：积累宝贵的经验
seize opportunities：抓住机会
acquire happiness：获得幸福
achieve success：取得成就
discard carelessly：随意丢弃
absence/lack of consciousness of：缺乏……的意识
pose a great challenge/threat to：对……构成挑战/威胁
provide a liberal and favorable environment：提供自由宽松的环境
pursuit of wealth and social status：追求财富和社会地位
at the expense of：以……为代价
**********************************************************
intense competition：激烈的竞争
academic cheating：学术作弊
eager for instant success and quick profits：急功近利
immediate benefits：短期利益
supervision system：监管体系
scientific management：科学的管理
fair competition：公平的竞争
career promotion：职场晋升
personal relationship：人际关系
face-to-face communication：面对面的交流
physical fitness：身体健康
social network tools：社交工具
numerous information：海量信息

以上所列的词汇，难免挂一漏万。因此，还需要各位考生，多多揣摩真题范文，做好笔记，时时处处做个有心人，积少成多，筑起更丰富的、属于自己的、独一无二的作文素材积累！

description:
Ever made a university bucket list? With only a few weeks left of her degree, Eleanor Doughty——a third-year student at QMUL, takes a look over hers and makes some suggestions.你有列过大学毕业愿望清单么？在离毕业只有几个星期的时候，埃莉诺·道蒂——一名伦敦大学玛丽女王学院三年级的学生，看着自己的愿望清单，和大家分享一些建议。

1. My Personal Review1. 我的个人回顾

I have achieved a lot in my three undergraduate years. I have lived alone and haven't overslept for morning lectures. I’ve been “Mum” of the house and have hoovered, washed up and dusted - probably far more than I needed to.大学三年里，我做到了很多事情。一个人住，而且从没在早晨有课时睡过头过。我成了房子里的“母亲”，自己打扫和清洗——恐怕都有些操劳过多了。

I have extra-curriculars coming out of my ears, I have learnt how to put up a shower curtain rail (something everyone should know how to do) and I’ve managed the bills. I am now a capable adult, and I’ve (hopefully) got a degree in the process. It’s all gone rather well.我参加过非常多的课外活动，有时自己都会忙不过来，我学会了怎样安装浴帘杆（这是每个人都应该会做的），并且付掉了自己的账单。现在，我是一个有生活能力的大人了，在这个过程中我也将拿到学位（希望如此）。一切都很好。

However, I haven’t done anything spectacular. I haven’t climbed Kilimanjaro or been to Machu Picchu, I haven't cycled to Paris from London (or anywhere else), or swum the Channel. I wasn’t even a Games Maker at the Olympic Games and I live five minutes away from the stadium.然而，我没有做过任何精彩的事情。我没有爬过非洲乞力马扎罗山，没有去过秘鲁的马丘比丘，没有从伦敦骑行到巴黎，也没有游泳穿越海峡。我住在距离伦敦奥运会场五分钟路程以外，却连志愿者都没去当。

It wasn't from lack of inclination, I just haven't had the time. Even with my four hours of contact time per week.不是我不想，只是没有时间——即使在每星期只有四个课时的时候。

2. What Is Available On the Internet2. 网上流行的毕业清单

So, it was only yesterday, when I booked my graduation tickets, that I revisited the idea of a university bucket list.所以，只是在昨天订了毕业典礼的入场券之后，我重新开始考虑大学愿望清单这个想法。

The Internet has loads of them: ‘57 things to do before you graduate’. Most of them are tedious, including banal entries like ‘apply for internships and jobs’, as if that wasn’t obvious.网上有很多相关内容：“毕业前要做的57件事”。列举的很多都比较无趣，包括诸如“找实习，找工作”这样的平庸条款，这还用说么？

I’m not one for bucket lists, but I do like a good life appraisal; an end of (the final) term report, if you will. So I sat down to see how many points I could tick off on the various generic lists.我不是热衷于列愿望清单的人，但的确喜欢给生活做个好的评估：比如可以准备（最后一个）学期末报告。所以，我坐了下来，看看这各种概括清单中提到的愿望，我可以勾掉几条。

There are some that I’m on board with. ‘Hand in an essay early’ – this has applied to me on every occasion but one since 2011. ‘Sit in on a lecture that’s completely out of your field’ – this I managed accidentally last year, and it took me too long to realise it was Maths and not Modernism I had stumbled into. I left hastily, Ulysses in hand.这些是我做到了的。“早交论文”——2011年后，除了一次例外，我每次都有做到。“听一个和你的领域完全不沾边的讲座”——这点我在去年意外实现了，而且过了很久我才意识到自己无意乱入的讲座是关于数学而不是现代主义。匆匆离开时，手里还拿着《尤里西斯》。

Other points, not so much. ‘Hire a bike for a week and see how it works out for you’ – I live on Mile End Road and value my life, so no thanks. ‘Go and see the art department’s end of year show’ – Queen Mary doesn’t offer art as a subject. ‘Make a kite and fly it’ – I’m all for DIY but has anyone ever made a kite successful, apart from Neil Buchanan on Art Attack?其他的一些条，做到的不是很多。“租一个星期自行车，看看这样做对生活的影响”——我住在伦敦高速公路英里路尽头，而且我惜命，所以谢谢了，但我不要骑车。“去看艺术部的年终盛典”——玛丽女王学院没有把艺术作为主题。“做个风筝飞飞”——我喜欢自己动手做，但是除了“艺术创想”节目中的尼尔·布坎南，有人成功做好过风筝么？

3. Start My Own List3. 我眼中的毕业清单

Because all these suggestions were pretty rubbish – and largely irrelevant to student life – for the first time ever I made my own bucket list. This one is retrospective – you could say it's more of a highlights reel of the last three years.因为所有这些建议都蛮垃圾的——而且和学生生活实在没多大关系——所以生平第一次，我制作了自己的愿望清单。这个是回顾性的——你可以讲这更多是一个过去三年大学生活的亮点集锦。

Instead of being things I want to do before I graduate, it’s things that I think everyone should do, and mainly stuff I’ve already done. For that reason, some are quite specific, but they were all formative experiences.在这我不是要列举自己在毕业前想做的事情，而是分享个人认为每个人都该在毕业前去做的事情，其中主要的我已经做过了。因而很多列举都很具体，但这些都是有助于成长的经历。

I reckon, if you haven’t got a bucket list (or you’d like to add to yours), they might be fun things to try. Especially if you’re not a finalist and have some time on your hands. Lucky.我想着，如果你还没有毕业愿望清单（或者你想要加些事情到你的清单去），这些有意思的事情值得一试。尤其如果不是毕业在即，那么你很幸运，还有时间。

As for me, in my last few days as an undergraduate, I'm going on a library tour. Yep, it's sad, but that's what finals do to you. I'm going to try and work in every library that my student card allows me access to.至于我，在大学生涯的最后几天中，我要巡游图书馆。是有些惨，但都是被期末考逼的。我要挨个儿去每个用我的学生卡可以进去的图书馆学习！

Why? Because although it's a place of hell for so many, I'm really going to miss the library. This is the last week of my life when going to the library will legitimately be my day job. I'm going to relish it. 为什么？因为尽管图书馆对于很多人是炼狱，离开校园后我却真的会想念。这是我人生中最后这样一个星期——当白天泡图书馆仍是我的工作，我要去享受这样的日子。

Sit on a committee of some kind参加XX委员会

Everyone should experience the rollercoaster of emotions that is organising other people.每个人都应该去体验其他人在委员会面前经历的情绪过山车。

Attend your university’s Varsity参加大学代表队

Best fun you’ll have all year. With me please: V-A-R-S-I-T-Y.这会是你每年最有趣的经历噢。请和我一起参加：大学代表队！

Cook a dinner as good as your Mum’s做顿可以和妈妈手艺相媲美的晚餐

My mac ‘n’ cheese is up there with the home version now. You too can do it (with Delia’s help).我做的奶酪通心粉现在已经是家传版本的啦。你也可以噢（照着英国烹饪天后迪莉娅的指南)！

Drink the SU dry在学生会喝酒喝爽

There was a night in January with ten glasses of wine and not enough crisps. Do this once and never again.一月份的一个晚上，喝了十杯酒，吃了一点薯片。这样疯狂一次，以后就再也别了。

Find your exam term library crush考试季疯狂爱上图书馆

They will unwittingly get you through finals.这样的爱，会让你不知不觉笑傲期末考。

Learn your landlord’s limits掌握你房东/宿管的极限

And also yours with white goods. 还有不要弄坏自己家里的白色电器（冰箱、洗衣机等）。

Function without the Internet when your provider fails断网时，学会继续生活

My flat did this for ten days in September and we can now use a dongle. Harder than it sounds.九月份，我的公寓断网十天。现在，我们可以用蓝牙适配器连网了。用起来比听起来难噢。

Face your alcohol fear直面你对酒精的恐惧

Good life lesson on determination. Bad experience with Sambuca? Get a shot and realise it's not actually that bad. ‘Insert double Tequila here.’ 这是关于决断力很好的一课。有萨姆布卡茴香酒的心理阴影？来一杯，你会意识到这酒也没那么糟。“这儿要双倍龙舌兰。”

Wear your university hoody with pride穿起学校的文化衫，并为之自豪

The second you leave you'll find the very idea of putting it on a little sad. It just won't feel the same.要离开的那刻，你会意识到再穿时会有些许伤感。总之，那个时候感觉就变了。

Make the most of every student discount out there充分利用你所有的学生折扣

Or, ideally, shop exclusively at places that offer one for a week. You'll miss it when you graduate.或者，理想的是，去所有提供每周学生折扣的店里购物。毕业的时候，你会想念的！
